item.title: Road to Productivity: The Effect of Roads on Manufacturing TFP in India
Spatial Interactions and the Political Economics of Public Provision: Evidence from India
Top-Down Versus Bottom-Up Strategies for Slum Development: Theory and Evidence from India
The heterogeneous effect of political competition on government responsiveness in India
Political Competition and Government Responsiveness: Evidence from Rural India
Political Economics
item.description: How do political-economic factors affect governemnt responsiveness? What explains the heterogeneity in the provision of public goods? Governments play an important welfare-enhancing role. In developing countries, public services are often deficient and of poor quality. Why does democracy struggle to ensure the provision of public services in developing countries? To understand this, I examine the relationship between different political-economic factors and government responsiveness at the sub-national level in India.
